questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is false?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is false?

options.option_text: Linear contrast stretching is a point operation.
Moving average is an example of local operation.
Convolution in the spatial domain can be obtained through addition in thefrequency domain.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is True
question_texts: Which of the following statements is True

options.option_text: Gaussian filter is Separable filter because it is non linear.
Median filter is a non separable filter
Gaussian filter is a High Pass filter.
Mean filter is a non separable filter because it is non linear

questions.question_text_1: Identify the correct sequence of steps in a Canny edge detection pipeline. Steps are listed below:  1. Compute gradient magnitude and direction 2. Connect individual components 3. Smoothen the image 4. Threshold into strong, weak, or no edge 5. Gaussian Filter and Hysteresis 6. Non-maximum suppression 7. Apply derivative to get edges
question_texts: Identify the correct sequence of steps in a Canny edge detection pipeline. Steps are listed below:  1. Compute gradient magnitude and direction 2. Connect individual components 3. Smoothen the image 4. Threshold into strong, weak, or no edge 5. Gaussian Filter and Hysteresis 6. Non-maximum suppression 7. Apply derivative to get edges

questions.question_text_1: Identify the correct sequence of steps in Scale Invariant Feature Transform (SIFT) method. Steps listed below:  1. Keypoint Descriptor 2. Keypoint Localization 3. Scale-space Extrema Detection 4. Orientation Estimation
question_texts: Identify the correct sequence of steps in Scale Invariant Feature Transform (SIFT) method. Steps listed below:  1. Keypoint Descriptor 2. Keypoint Localization 3. Scale-space Extrema Detection 4. Orientation Estimation

questions.question_text_1: Suppose we have a codebook of 2048 SIFT visual words. We extract 1000 SIFT descriptors (SIFT is a 128-dimensional feature) from a new image. What is the dimensionality of the BoW (Bag-of-Words) descriptor?
question_texts: Suppose we have a codebook of 2048 SIFT visual words. We extract 1000 SIFT descriptors (SIFT is a 128-dimensional feature) from a new image. What is the dimensionality of the BoW (Bag-of-Words) descriptor?

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements are false?
question_texts: Which of the following statements are false?

options.option_text: Momentum in optimization can cause oscillations around minima whenencountering flat regions or saddle points due to the dominance of the momentum term over the small gradient.
Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD) with its inherent noise can be beneficial inescaping local minima and saddle points, provided that there is enough gradient information in the neighborhood.
Adagrad is an optimization algorithm introduced to overcome the diminishinglearning rate problem in techniques like RMSProp.
ADAM is introduced to solve problems in RMSProp by combining RMSProp andAdagrad techniques.

questions.question_text_1: The gradient of an image I, points in the direction of most rapid change in intensity, taking image derivatives accentuates (a) ____________ frequencies and hence amplifies noise, since the proportion of noise to signal is larger at (b) __________ frequencies. The solution to this is (c) _________ the image prior to computing gradients.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
question_texts: The gradient of an image I, points in the direction of most rapid change in intensity, taking image derivatives accentuates (a) ____________ frequencies and hence amplifies noise, since the proportion of noise to signal is larger at (b) __________ frequencies. The solution to this is (c) _________ the image prior to computing gradients.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: Enter the correct answer for (a).  NOTE: Enter the exact answer without any space in the beginning or at the end.
question_texts: Enter the correct answer for (a).  NOTE: Enter the exact answer without any space in the beginning or at the end.
